text.0: we will present fair praise unto the mighty one our hymns to indra in vivasvāns dwellingplace.
text.1: for he hath neer found wealth in those who seem to sleep those who give wealth to men accept no paltry praise.
text.2: giver of horses indra giver thou of kine giver of barley thou art lord and guard of wealth.
text.3: mans helper from of old not disappointing hope friend of our friends to thee as such we sing this praise.
text.4: indra most splendid powerful rich in mighty deeds this treasure spread around is known to be thine own.
text.5: gather therefrom o conqueror and bring to us fail not the hope of him who loves and sings to thee.
text.6: well pleased with these bright flames and with these soma drops take thou away our poverty with seeds and kine.
text.7: with indra scattering the dasyu through these drops freed from their hate may we obtain abundant food.
text.8: let us obtain o indra plenteous wealth and food with strength exceeding glorious shining to the sky.
text.9: may we obtain the goddess providence the strength of heroes special source of cattle rich in steeds.
text.10: these our libations strengthinspiring soma draughts gladdened thee in the fight with vṛtra hero lord.
text.11: what time thou slewest for the singer with trimmed grass ten thousand vṛtras thou resistless in thy might.
text.12: thou goest on from fight to fight intrepidly destroying castle after castle here with strength.
text.13: thou indra with thy friend who makes the foe bow down slewest from far away the guileful namuci.
text.14: thou hast struck down in death karañja parṇaya in atithigvas very glorious going forth.
text.15: unyielding when Ṛjiśvan compassed them with siege thou hast destroyed the hundred forts of vaṅgṛida.
text.16: with alloutstripping chariotwheel o indra thou farfamed hast overthrown the twice ten kings of men.
text.17: with sixty thousand nineandninety followers who came in arms to fight with friendless suśravas.
text.18: thou hast protected suśravas with succour and tūrvayāṇa with thine aid o indra.
text.19: thou madest kutsa atithigva Āyu subject unto this king the young the mighty.
text.20: may we protected by the gods hereafter remain thy very prosperous friends o indra.
text.21: thee we extol enjoying through thy favour life long and joyful and with store of heroes.
